feed.title: State of the Map 2020 schedule updates

entry.title: New State of the Map 2020 schedule released (0.6)
entry.summary:
A new State of the Map 2020 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version! Two talks were switched to resolve a session-host-shift conflict.

We had to move some talks, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “Trademarks & OSMF” by Kathleen Lu (July 5, 2020, 3:45 p.m., Track 1 → July 5, 2020, 8 p.m., Track 2)
  • “Earthquakes and OpenStreetMap” by Danijel Schorlemmer (July 5, 2020, 8 p.m., Track 2 → July 5, 2020, 3:45 p.m., Track 1)

entry.title: New State of the Map 2020 schedule released (0.5)
entry.summary:
A new State of the Map 2020 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version! Unfortunately, we had to cancel two talks, so we also had to move around some others to fill those gaps.

Sadly, we had to cancel talks:

  • “Use of OSM data in formalizing informal public transport systems, case of Maputo-Mozambique” by Remígio Chilaule
  • “Rapid Mapping of 50 Communes in Madagascar” by Seth Cochran

We had to move some talks, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “OSM Quiz” by SotM Working Group (July 5, 2020, 9:30 p.m. → July 5, 2020, 8:45 p.m.)
  • “Trademarks & OSMF” by Kathleen Lu (July 5, 2020, 8:45 p.m. → July 5, 2020, 3:45 p.m.)
  • “Minutely Extracts: Tools for nimble editing and downloading” by 劉知岳 (July 5, 2020, 8:45 p.m., Track 2 → July 5, 2020, 5:15 p.m., Track 1)
  • “Closing” by SotM Working Group (July 5, 2020, 9:50 p.m. → July 5, 2020, 9:05 p.m.)

entry.title: New State of the Map 2020 schedule released (0.4)
entry.summary:
A new State of the Map 2020 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version! This update mostly contains minor changes like text improvements.

entry.title: New State of the Map 2020 schedule released (0.3)
entry.summary:
A new State of the Map 2020 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version! Two talks were switched to better accommodate the time zones of some of the speakers, so please check if you have to adapt your plans.

We had to move some talks, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “Minutely Extracts: Tools for nimble editing and downloading” by 劉知岳 (July 5, 2020, 5:15 p.m., Track 1 → July 5, 2020, 8:45 p.m., Track 2)
  • “Rapid Mapping of 50 Communes in Madagascar” by Seth Cochran (July 5, 2020, 8:45 p.m., Track 2 → July 5, 2020, 5:15 p.m., Track 1)

entry.title: New State of the Map 2020 schedule released (0.2)
entry.summary:
A new State of the Map 2020 schedule has been released!

We released a new schedule version! We have added some additional talks and had to move some that were already in the schedule, so please check if you have to adapt your plans.

We have new talks!

  • “Building Stronger Communities Together - the Local Chapters & Community Working Group”
  • “Rapid Mapping of 50 Communes in Madagascar”
  • “Identify map problems in OSM by connectivity check”

We had to move some talks, so if you were planning on seeing them, check their new dates or locations:

  • “Meet an OpenStreetMapper” by Gregory Marler (July 4, 2020, 9:30 p.m. → July 4, 2020, 10:15 p.m.)
  • “Earthquakes and OpenStreetMap” by Danijel Schorlemmer (July 5, 2020, 12:15 p.m., Track 1 → July 5, 2020, 8 p.m., Track 2)

entry.title: New State of the Map 2020 schedule released (0.1)
entry.summary:
The first State of the Map 2020 schedule has been released!

We released our first schedule version!
